solution_01_data_basics/01_counting/07_read_histogram_discrete_v2

video

The first 4 questions involve adding up frequencies of the indicated intervals. The last 4 questions can be done by guessing and checking until something works.


  1. (ANS=68) There are 68 measurements less than 9.5. So, \(\#[\mathbf{x}<9.5]=68\).
  2. (ANS=16) There are 16 measurements more than 7.5. So, \(\#[\mathbf{x}>7.5]=16\).
  3. (ANS=10) There are 10 measurements closer than 1 units from 4.5. So, \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-4.5|<1]=10\).
  4. (ANS=56) There are 56 measurements further than 1 units from 8.5. So, \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-8.5|>1]=56\).
  5. (ANS=3.5) A boundary at \(b=3.5\) has 25 measurements less than it. So, \(\#[\mathbf{x}<3.5]=25\).
  6. (ANS=6.5) A boundary at \(b=6.5\) has 22 measurements more than it. So, \(\#[\mathbf{x}>6.5]=22\).
  7. (ANS=1) An interval with radius \(r=1\) around center 4.5 contains 10 measurements. So, \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-4.5|<1]=10\).
  8. (ANS=1.5) An interval with radius \(r=1.5\) around center 3 excludes 49 measurements. So, \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-3|>1.5]=49\).
